intro: Diaphananthe ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf diaphananthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
